content: ah right, @Albin Stjerna with our DST I'm not sure either when is the meeting, now or in an hour @nikomatsakis ? in any case I myself don't have a lot to say this time, maybe that can allow for Niko to catch up on the previous weeks questions/PRs ?
:wave: that sounds reasonable
I've been swamped ;)
you don't say :)
is it supposed to be now ?
(likely, as it used to at 9PM and it's now 8PM with the 1hour switch)
I believe so
fwiw next week I think we're aligned again
I've been thinking about that idea of a polonius week :)
(just in case you haven't seen it I've mentioned in the other topic I'll be away at rustfest next week, and might miss the next couple meetings because of that)
ok, Id idn't see that yet, but I will go catch up on topics
I'm thinking about trying to pick a date for a polonius focus week -- probably early dec -- and then coming up with some list of tasks that, if I can get them done, justify such a luxurious thing
some of list of tasks to achieve during the polonius week ?
which would be worthwhile enough to justify said week heh :)
let me ask this question -- if I were going to try and focus largly on polonius, would Nov 18-22 or Dec 2-6 be better... the week of Nov 25-29 I'll be Iceland :frosty: :snowflake:
I myself could make either work, what about @Albin Stjerna ? @Matthew Jasper I'd assume it would be hard for you ?
(they might reply asynchronously :)
yep
I'll try to catch up a bit
I think December would be slightly better for me, but both would work!
so the downside of Dec would be that I am just getting back from vacation. Maybe Nov is wiser.
Getting back from vacation usually means a lot of accumulated things to catch up on :)
let's pencil in november then, at least until we know more about whether Albin and Matthew can/want to participate
Sounds good!
I probably can't spend 8 hours a day, but I'll see how much I can sneak from my PhD studies :)
I'll make sure to be able to do SOMETHING every day at least

I probably can't spend 8 hours a day, but I'll see how much I can sneak from my PhD studies :)

heh probably I can't either but I"m going to think hard about what I can do
Here's what I think we should do:
I think we should try to schedule a 1hr meeting (but when!) to "pre-plan" goals for work week -- maybe we can extend this meeting next wek?
one thing I think would be helpful would be just kind of enumerating "all the in-flight things"
I sort of feel like we did this last time though
so feel free to point me to a list
Agreed!
ok I'll try to make myself available next week, and we have the beginnings of such list of in-flight things, let me get you the link
it's https://hackmd.io/wGwGGRCKStiWBq9voP4e2A and I'll update it by next week so that it contains all we've done in the last 2 months
Does this mean the meeting is over now?
niko has likely flown away to greener pastures :)
so let's say that it is
:wave:

(I didn't have a lot of time for polonius this week as I investigated niko's universes PR, and did a couple of rustc bisections, and will not have a lot this week either, but will get the list updated for sure)
heh sorry got distracted :)
one thing I did also want to mention
I have some pretty concrete ideas about how traits + region checking + polonius should interact
that I have had no time to explore
we may or may not talk about them in next week's traits design meeting
but if not we should consider scheduling a one-off discussion on the topic, and/or I can work on blog posts, etc
I was going to mention this earlier actually, since it links both wg-traits and wg-polonius in a sense, esp if that implies polonius requiring chalk in rustc
and this work is arguably worthwhile for a focus week :p
yes!
interesting
(I also can't help but think about XSB, the datalog engine using a SLG solver :p)
Is XSB a datalog engine?
I just thought it was a general logic engine
Maybe I never looked that closely :)
yeah maybe general
I tried e-mailing the author a time or two but we never arranged a time to really talk

I have read a couple of "totally unbiased I promise" papers of theirs where they boast better perf than logicblox with leapfrog triejoin and Demand Transformation (Frank has forever messed with my recollection of the join's name...)
